Name: DIETHYLENE GLYCOL DIETHYL ETHER
Description: 1-ethoxy-2-(2-ethoxyethoxy)ethane is a polyether that consists of undecane in which the carbon atoms at positions 3, 6 and 9 are replaced by oxygen atoms.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Funasaki N et al; J Phys Chem 88: 5786-90 (1984) (2) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods. Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc pp. 4-9 (1990) (3) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 3 was calculated in fish for diethylene glycol diethyl ether(SRC), using a log Kow of 0.39(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Fincher EL, Payne WJ; Appl Microbiol 10: 542-7 (1962) (2) Heukelekian H, Rand MC; J Water Pollut Contr Assoc 29: 1040-55 (1955) (3) Cowan RM, Kwon J; pp. 273-82 in Hazard Ind Wastes, 31st Technomic Pub Co., Inc., p 273-82 (1999)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: AEROBIC: An aerobic biodegradation study using gram-negative asporogenous rod bacterium isolated from soil by enrichment on triethylene glycol exhibited borderline growth (scarcely detectable growth, not reproducible) with diethylene glycol diethyl ether(1). In a screening study using a sewage seed, diethylene glycol diethyl ether (concentration not specified) had a 10 day BOD of 0.10 g/g (4.2% theoretical BOD) at 20 °C(2). Diethylene glycol diethyl ether had a 21.7% COD removal at 30 °C from a starting concentration of 600 mg COD/L (time period not given) indicating little degradation compared to 95% degradation of ethylene glycol monophenyl ether(3).

logP.References: Funasaki N et al; J Phys Chem 88: 5786-5790 (1984)

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Grant, W.M. Toxicology of the Eye. 3rd ed. Springfield, IL: Charles C. Thomas Publisher, 1986., p. 1030
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ The compound was tested externally on the eyes of rabbits, and, according to the degree of injury observed after 24 hours, rated on a scale of 1 to 10. The most severely injurious substances have been rated 10. Diethylene glycol diethyl ether rated 3 to 4 on rabbit eyes.

/LABORATORY ANIMALS: Developmental or Reproductive Toxicity/ Fifty pregnant CD-1 mice were given 3,000 mg/kg/day of diethylene glycol diethyl ether in water by gavage on days 6-13 of gestation and allowed to deliver. The test agent reduced maternal weight gain but had no effect on the offspring of treated animals.

/LABORATORY ANIMALS: Developmental or Reproductive Toxicity/ ...Diethylene glycol diethyl ether (diEGdiEE) ... was administered on days 7 through 14 to pregnant /CD-1 mice/ at a single dose estimated to be at or just below the threshold of adult lethality ... There was a slight reduction in the average number of live pups per litter in the diEGdiEE-treated group and ... the number dead per litter was increased ... Individual pup weight at day 1 postpartum was only significantly reduced by diEGdiEE, and no gross congenital abnormalities were detected in neonates ...

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Croce G; Ferrini R; Boll Soc Ital Biol Sper 49 (11): 653 (1973)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /OTHER TOXICITY INFORMATION/ Stimulated choleresis when injected intraduodenally at 1 mL/kg into rats.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Bingham, E.; Cohrssen, B.; Powell, C.H.; Patty's Toxicology Volumes 1-9 5th ed. John Wiley & Sons. New York, N.Y. (2001)., p. V7 177
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ ... /Diethylene glycol diethyl ether/ if splashed into the eyes, it would cause conjunctival irritation and slight transitory injury of the cornea.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Funasaki N et al; J Phys Chem 88: 5786-90 (1984) (2) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods. Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc pp. 4-9 (1990) (3) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: The Koc of diethylene glycol diethyl ether is estimated as 39(SRC), using a log Kow of 0.39(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this estimated Koc value suggests that diethylene glycol diethyl ether is expected to have very high mobility in soil.
